Yes, you can install the `kcadm.sh` CLI on a Linux box without installing the full Keycloak server. You can download the Keycloak server distribution package from the Keycloak website and extract the `kcadm.sh` script from it.

Here are the steps to install the `kcadm.sh` CLI without installing the full Keycloak server:

1. Download the Keycloak server distribution package from the Keycloak website: <https://www.keycloak.org/downloads.html>
2. Extract the downloaded archive file to a directory of your choice:
```php
tar -xzf keycloak-<version>.tar.gz
```
Replace `<version>` with the version number of the Keycloak server distribution package that you have downloaded.
3. Navigate to the `bin` directory inside the extracted Keycloak server distribution directory:
```bash
cd keycloak-<version>/bin
```
4. Copy the `kcadm.sh` script from the `bin` directory to a directory in your `$PATH` environment variable. For example, you can copy it to `/usr/local/bin`:
```bash
sudo cp kcadm.sh /usr/local/bin
```
This will allow you to run the `kcadm.sh` script from any directory on your Linux box.
5. Set the execute permission on the `kcadm.sh` script:
```bash
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/kcadm.sh
```
This will give the execute permission to the `kcadm.sh` script, allowing you to run it.

Once you have completed these steps, you can use the `kcadm.sh` script to execute Keycloak commands using the CLI.
